intro: Diplazium travancoricum, commonly known as the Travancore water fern, is a species of fern native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, frond-like leaves that are typically divided into pinnae. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories and along stream banks. Its rhizomes are creeping and help in the propagation of the species. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
